ud1.3:1.2: At one time, when he was first awakened, the Buddha was staying near Uruvelā at the root of the tree of awakening on the bank of the Nerañjarā River.
ud1.3:1.3: There the Buddha sat cross-legged for seven days without moving, experiencing the bliss of freedom.
ud1.3:1.4: When seven days had passed, the Buddha emerged from that state of immersion. In the last part of the night, he reflected on dependent origination in forward and reverse order:
ud1.3:2.1: “When this exists, that is; due to the arising of this, that arises.
ud1.3:2.2: When this doesn’t exist, that is not; due to the cessation of this, that ceases. That is:
ud1.3:2.3: Ignorance is a condition for choices.
ud1.3:2.4: Choices are a condition for consciousness.
ud1.3:2.5: Consciousness is a condition for name and form.
ud1.3:2.6: Name and form are conditions for the six sense fields.
ud1.3:2.7: The six sense fields are conditions for contact.
ud1.3:2.8: Contact is a condition for feeling.
ud1.3:2.9: Feeling is a condition for craving.
ud1.3:2.10: Craving is a condition for grasping.
ud1.3:2.11: Grasping is a condition for continued existence.
ud1.3:2.12: Continued existence is a condition for rebirth.
ud1.3:2.13: Rebirth is a condition for old age and death, sorrow, lamentation, pain, sadness, and distress to come to be.
ud1.3:2.14: That is how this entire mass of suffering originates.
ud1.3:3.1: When ignorance fades away and ceases with nothing left over, choices cease.
ud1.3:3.3: When consciousness ceases, name and form cease.
ud1.3:3.4: When name and form cease, the six sense fields cease.
ud1.3:3.5: When the six sense fields cease, contact ceases.
ud1.3:3.9: When grasping ceases, continued existence ceases.
ud1.3:3.10: When continued existence ceases, rebirth ceases.
ud1.3:3.11: When rebirth ceases, old age and death, sorrow, lamentation, pain, sadness, and distress cease.
ud1.3:3.12: That is how this entire mass of suffering ceases.”
ud1.3:4.1: Then, knowing the meaning of this, on that occasion the Buddha expressed this heartfelt sentiment:
ud1.3:5.4: as the sun lights up the sky.”
